brainly_data.question: Have you heard an ambulance, police car, or fire truck recently? Did you notice that the pitch of the siren changed as it approached you and then again as it moved away? What concept explains this change or shift in sound waves? A) Doppler effect B) changes in speed C) Bernoulli effect D) changes in temperature
brainly_data.subject: Physics

all_answers.question: Have you heard an ambulance, police car, or fire truck recently? Did you notice that the pitch of the siren changed as it approached you and then again as it moved away? What concept explains this change or shift in sound waves? A) Doppler effect B) changes in speed C) Bernoulli effect D) changes in temperature
all_answers.subject: Physics
all_answers.text:
1).  Why, yes !  I hear ambulances, police cars, or fire trucks frequently.

2).  Why, yes again !  I do notice that the pitch of the siren changes as it approaches me, and then again as it moves away.

3).  My understanding is that this change or shift in the perceived frequency 
of sound waves is described by the math of the "Doppler effect".
